article.description: Kalob Ledoux scored 20 points and Jarren Greenwood scored 16 points and McNeese beat NCCAA member Ecclesia 101-54 on Monday night in the Cowboys' home opener.
article.headline: McNeese roughs up Ecclesia in 101-54 home-opening win
article.linkText: McNeese roughs up Ecclesia in 101-54 home-opening win
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. -- Kalob Ledoux scored 20 points and Jarren Greenwood scored 16 points and McNeese beat NCCAA member Ecclesia 101-54 on Monday night in the Cowboys' home opener. Ecclesia was competitive early taking an 8-2 lead with the help of a pair of 3-pointers from Dequcelan Bagsby before McNeese (1-1) went on a 13-0 run to take over the game with Greenwood scoring seven points during that stretch. The Cowboys led 48-30 at halftime and went on to score 53 after the break. James Harvey scored 12 points, Jacob Ledoux chipped in 10 and 13 different McNeese players entered the scoring column. The Cowboys were 12 for 29 (41.4 percent) from 3-point range and outscored the Royals 21-2 in second-chance points. Chris White led Ecclesia with 14 points, Cash Kruger scored 11 and Bagsby chipped in 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
